trans-unit.source: dotnet-test
trans-unit.target: dotnet-test

trans-unit.source: dotnet-test
trans-unit.target: dotnet-test

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: dotnet-test
trans-unit.target: dotnet-test

trans-unit.source: NAME
trans-unit.target: NAME

trans-unit.source: - Runs unit tests using the configured test runner
trans-unit.target: - Runs unit tests using the configured test runner

trans-unit.source: SYNOPSIS
trans-unit.target: SYNOPSIS

trans-unit.source: DESCRIPTION
trans-unit.target: DESCRIPTION

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet test` command is used to execute unit tests in a given project.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet test` command is used to execute unit tests in a given project.

trans-unit.source: Unit tests are class library projects that have dependencies on the unit test framework (for example, NUnit or xUnit) and the dotnet test runner for that unit testing framework.
trans-unit.target: Unit tests are class library projects that have dependencies on the unit test framework (for example, NUnit or xUnit) and the dotnet test runner for that unit testing framework.

trans-unit.source: These are packaged as NuGet packages and are restored as ordinary dependencies for the project.
trans-unit.target: These are packaged as NuGet packages and are restored as ordinary dependencies for the project.

trans-unit.source: Test projects also need to specify a test runner property in project.json using the "testRunner" node.
trans-unit.target: Test projects also need to specify a test runner property in project.json using the "testRunner" node.

trans-unit.source: This value should contain the name of the unit test framework.
trans-unit.target: This value should contain the name of the unit test framework.

trans-unit.source: The following sample project.json shows the properties needed:
trans-unit.target: The following sample project.json shows the properties needed:

trans-unit.source: supports two running modes:
trans-unit.target: supports two running modes:

trans-unit.source: Console: In console mode, `dotnet test` simply executes fully any command gets passed to it and outputs the results.
trans-unit.target: Console: In console mode, `dotnet test` simply executes fully any command gets passed to it and outputs the results.

trans-unit.source: Anytime you invoke `dotnet test` without passing --port, it runs in console mode, which in turn will cause the runner to run in console mode.
trans-unit.target: Anytime you invoke `dotnet test` without passing --port, it runs in console mode, which in turn will cause the runner to run in console mode.

trans-unit.source: Design time: used in the context of other tools, such as editors or Integrated Development Environments (IDEs).
trans-unit.target: Design time: used in the context of other tools, such as editors or Integrated Development Environments (IDEs).

trans-unit.source: You can find out more about this mode in the [dotnet-test protocol](test-protocol.md) document.
trans-unit.target: You can find out more about this mode in the [dotnet-test protocol](test-protocol.md) document.

trans-unit.source: OPTIONS
trans-unit.target: OPTIONS

trans-unit.source: Specifies a path to the test project.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a path to the test project.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, it defaults to current directory.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, it defaults to current directory.

trans-unit.source: , `--configuration` [Debug|Release]
trans-unit.target: , `--configuration` [Debug|Release]

trans-unit.source: Configuration under which to build.
trans-unit.target: Configuration under which to build.

trans-unit.source: The default value is Release.
trans-unit.target: The default value is Release.

trans-unit.source: , `--output` [DIR]
trans-unit.target: , `--output` [DIR]

trans-unit.source: Directory in which to find binaries to run.
trans-unit.target: Directory in which to find binaries to run.

trans-unit.source: , `--build-base-path` [DIR]
trans-unit.target: , `--build-base-path` [DIR]

trans-unit.source: Directory in which to place temporary outputs.
trans-unit.target: Directory in which to place temporary outputs.

trans-unit.source: , `--framework` [FRAMEWORK]
trans-unit.target: , `--framework` [FRAMEWORK]

trans-unit.source: Looks for test binaries for a specific framework.
trans-unit.target: Looks for test binaries for a specific framework.

trans-unit.source: , `--runtime` [RUNTIME_IDENTIFIER]
trans-unit.target: , `--runtime` [RUNTIME_IDENTIFIER]

trans-unit.source: Look for test binaries for a for the specified runtime.
trans-unit.target: Look for test binaries for a for the specified runtime.

trans-unit.source: Does not build the test project prior to running it.
trans-unit.target: Does not build the test project prior to running it.

trans-unit.source: --parentProcessId
trans-unit.target: --parentProcessId

trans-unit.source: Used by IDEs to specify their process ID.
trans-unit.target: Used by IDEs to specify their process ID.

trans-unit.source: Test will exit if the parent process does.
trans-unit.target: Test will exit if the parent process does.

trans-unit.source: Used by IDEs to specify a port number to listen for a connection.
trans-unit.target: Used by IDEs to specify a port number to listen for a connection.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLES
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLES

trans-unit.source: Runs the tests in the project in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: Runs the tests in the project in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: Runs the tests in the test1 project.
trans-unit.target: Runs the tests in the test1 project.

trans-unit.source: SEE ALSO
trans-unit.target: SEE ALSO

trans-unit.source: dotnet-test communication protocol
trans-unit.target: dotnet-test communication protocol
